revised_title: A Review of William Cheselden's Osteographia
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of William Cheselden's book, Osteographia, which focuses on the anatomy of bones. The book features detailed illustrations of bones, made possible by the use of a camera obscura, and covers the growth and articulation of bones, as well as various diseased and remarkable bones. The author praises the quality and accuracy of the illustrations, but notes that the book does not delve deeply into descriptions, focusing more on the mechanical aspects of the bones.
